subject: Mental Health
title: Social Anxiety Disorder
description: A fast breakdown of Social Anxiety Disorder for builders.

hook.text: Walking into a room of strangers feels like stepping onto a stage naked.

buildup.text: Social anxiety turns ordinary interactions into threats of harsh judgment.

discovery.text: The brain overestimates how harshly others evaluate every word and gesture.

twist.text: Avoidance brings short relief but deepens the fear with each escape.

climax.text: It's the third most common mental health condition worldwide.

punchline.text: The audience is rarely as harsh as the critic inside.

quiz.question: What makes social anxiety self-reinforcing?
options: Avoidance deepens the fear over time
